author: easterntownhall
title: Eastern Hemisphere dRep TownHall
description: Participating as a dRep is difficult when you live in a different time zone and when English is not your main language.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal addresses the challenge brief in that it will tackle diversity, amount of DReps and decentralization. The Eastern Town Hall is Diverse in both number of non English speaking countries and population of the countries involved. The number of DReps involved is indeed leaning heavily on representation from Western countries. If the number of DReps from the Eastern Hemisphere increase, that will certainly make the system fairer. As the proposal states, supporting translation for 7 East Asian countries is a great start.
f6_assessments.q1: Eastern Town Hall have a solid team and experience completing proposals in past funds. The implementation plan is broken down in the link because the image is difficult to read. Both the experience of the team and the plan it is likely that the eastern hemisphere drep town hall will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPI's are clearly stated and it should be easy to check that the DRep Town Hall has been held once a month. Their experience in challenge teams and Town Halls. The existence of Questionnaires, Interviews, Observations, Documents and records, Focus groups is easy to verify.

f6_assessments.q0:
Yes. The proposal targets a large group of people who are currently under-represented. 

The graphs show that each of the 7 languages to be supported are underrepresented in Catalyst. 

Organizing a place for proposals from the Eastern Hemisphere is needed to diversify the group of dReps. Language barriers are very real for much of the world. This proposal addresses that problem head on.
f6_assessments.q1:
The group is very experienced with Cardano. They are also experienced community organizers. The group has a very high likelihood of creating a hub for people to share proposals, and share feedback on those proposals. 

The Catalyst program is evolving. The dRep program is very new. The point is that needs will change. The plan addresses the Catalyst process as it is now. The only hesitation is that the plan might be a little rigid and not allow for enough adaptation as times change. 


The workload could become very large. The group of proposers can likely manage current volume. A risk is that volume grows and there is not enough budget to hire more organizers.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes, absolutely there is enough information to audit this project. The matrix for evaluating is very clear, very thoughtful and thorough. The measures for auditing are objective and understandable by outside people.

f6_assessments.q0: The perspective this initiative seems to introduce to the ecosystem is the data gathering on Dreps from it’s onset. Apart from that, the framework here is to make proposals available in more than 7 different languages in the community in the southern hemisphere. This initiative is in sync with the objective of the drep improvement challenge setting. Translating  and making available plain english summaries of IOG dRep workshops and dRep research to the Eastern hemisphere community would help introduce the drep initiative to new audience and enhance more awareness on the Drep role within the Eastern hemisphere community. Additionally, I envisage  an increase in enrollment or on-boarding into the Drep role and an improved engagement within the dRep Chat. Obviously, the creation of a chat that accommodate all people with different language background to ask questions, share knowledge and ideas on the drep role fosters community engagement and create an entry point for new members into the dRep role.
f6_assessments.q1: The projects provides a detailed description of what would be done to achieve the overall goal. However, the information on the feasibility of the approach is insufficient. The only point worth noting here is the experience of the team. The team’s profile indicates a group of team members with an extensive level of experience that cut across all areas relevant to this project. These team members are professionals within  the Cardano ecosystem and have a lot of track record in terms of project execution. Therefore I am impressed with the team’s profile especially given the link attached to verify their expertise. Apart from that, I think the information provided at the budget section of this project provides a detailed budget breakdown that outline identifiable items with their associated budget allocation. Per my understanding of market prices of these items, I think the budget is more reasonable, accurate and moderate. Apart from that, by the outlook of the project, I am impressed by the roadmap; it anticipate and incorporate future events and how it could affect the project. Bythe design of the project, I agree with the proposer that the insufficient data on the drep role makes part of the activities difficult to be undertaken. I therefore anticipate that the rest of the activities would kick in when the first phase of the drep role is completed under this project. While they wait, the team plans to monitor 50 projects from the Eastern hemisphere community. I consider this laudable because it would offer them insight of what to work on.
f6_assessments.q2: Has the team provided sufficient information to help audit the project? My analysis of the proposal is that, the information provided is clearly sufficient to measure the success of the project.  I appreciate the impact the project intends to make with this project,  as the overall initiative and role is novel—make proposals available in more than 7 different languages in the southern hemisphere community.  In my view, KPIs like number of project monitored (from Eastern hemisphere community), number of participants E.H.C), number of statistical respondents, number of translation, number of plain English summaries, number of town halls and few others are more aligned KPIs to the objective of this project; and are more understandable and accurate metrics for determining the performance of the project. Apart from that, how would the data on these metrics be accessed by the community? I wish the team indicates  clearly if the team would update the community and how would it be done? Beyond this, I am satisfied with the input from the team.

f6_assessments.q0: By providing a safe place for different time zones and languages this proposal has the potential for global impact by getting more people involved in the community. I like the idea of onboarding and educating new people to create more diversity in the cardano ecosystem. To help with onboarding this proposal plans on creating a dRep chat and summarizing cardano improvement proposals in 7 different languages. While also connecting multiple languages to the main town hall.
f6_assessments.q1: I have high confidence in the teams ability to succeed due to their experience, community involvement, diverse locations, and previous catalyst funding. The budget for this proposal is broken down, clear and reasonable. The team addresses potiental risks but they have solutions. With the information given the timeline seems feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: I enjoyed the table break down I believe it helped with the clarity of the proposal. There are clear measures of sucess but there are not clear milestones which will make it a bit harder to audit. I'm not worried about that because this is a new idea and I believe this proposal is a necessary building block to help the community increase on diversity.

f6_assessments.q0: As language is one of the biggest barrier that is affecting the dReps to participate in voting, as there are many countries in the world where English has less proficiency , hence to set up a townhall where the proposer wants to collect all the projects related to Easter Hemisphere and  related statistics for each Fund and wants to	Translate & summarize in a CIP list, which is definitely a great idea where he wants to concentrate the region first for achieving the task, with clear goal ahead of improving the dReps role and developing regional economy this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
Setting up TownHall and conducting workshops can be achieved but the biggest challenge here is translating the data , the proposer has idea of translating the proposals to nearly 7 languages of native which quite difficult to achieve, the proposer has good idea where he wants to collect the proposal of only Eastern Hemisphere and then translate them to native, which is better task to achieve, instead of translating in uneven way.
The team has members from all the different countries who can speak different languages which will surely help in translating the proposal to required native language . Hence, with given experience and plan presented it is highly likely this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The audit has introduced all the team members that will be participating in the project and has introduced their experience in block chain, the team has selected members from different eastern region countries which will definitely help in translating the proposals to native .
The audit has clearly explained each step on how to complete the project where it involves collecting Eastern Hemisphere proposals and translating them , the audit has presented timeline and budget feasibility in detailed manner in the form of image. Hence, the information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
“Time difference is a big barrier for dReps to contribute to Cardano. If there was a place in Asia where dReps could join in the same time zone, that barrier would be removed. Through the issues outlined above, TownHall was built to tackle the challenge well.”
“The way the challenge is solved is this: hold a meeting in the Eastern Hemisphere in 7 languages ​​to exchange insights on liquid democracy, and support and introduce dReps in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is clear that the proposal is creating a trusted venue that is both a place where dReps can participate and a place to share the role of dRep globally.”
“The risk that the dRep launch program may be delayed is present, this is an objective cause, so the project will have to delay the schedule accordingly. In addition to the risk of translation quality, the team should have a more detailed risk management plan.”
f6_assessments.q1:
“The team has submitted a methodical project implementation plan, each month the work is arranged according to specific timelines.”
“The cost of all kinds of work to be done is therefore transparent and clear. Thereby the community can easily track the progress of the project.”
“The people who implement this project come from different countries of East Asia, they will play an important role in the development of dRep of the country in which they live. They are all people with long experience and working in the field of technology, having a certain influence in the community in which they operate. Everyone is well informed.”
f6_assessments.q2:
“Measurements to track project progress satisfy the challenge. Through indicators such as the number of proposals checked, the number of participants, the number of respondents, the number of translations, the community can easily monitor the project progress.”
“The proposal has given very specific and appropriate criteria to evaluate the success of the project. One of the most important is that TownHall will be the venue for monthly dRep, proponent and voter dialogues. This is also where dRep and dRep protest proponents can ask voters to vote or authorize.”
“With a team that comes from many different cultures and is all very good in their respective fields, I believe that the team will successfully launch an important project that contributes to the success of Cardano governance.”

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal identifies the problem very clear and I agree that this is important for Cardano ecosystem. To have a place where dRep, proposer and voters can discuss and coordinating is an important thing. Language can be a barrier for voters and most of the times they just need some people to ask and discuss to be able to vote. It will add the participation from community to involve in the voting process. It is a good project with clear key metrics and goal. It is a continually program that could really help to grow Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer provides link and reference from a solid team in this project. They are all have many experiences and well-known in their own community. The budget is outlined clearly and broken down in details. The budget is reasonable and enough to accomplish the work. Timetable is great and doable in the long run. The proposal also displayed clear solution and address many risks that might happen. It is a good proposal & program.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal has a very clear roadmap, well-thought metrics/KPIs, and also have a clear understandable description of the targeted problem that can be measured against the proposed outcomes. Community could also check the process of this project through the community, discord channel and also github channel that will be updated time to time.

solution: The Eastern Hemisphere Town Hall provides a safe place for the different time zones and languages of Eastern Hemisphere communities to learn, collaborate and build on Cardano.
experience: Cardano Foundation Ambassadors, Catalyst School & Eastern Town Hall Members, Proposal Assessors (PAs) & Veteran PAs, Challenge Team members, Cardano Stake Pool Operators (SPO), IT & Software Engineering, Blockchain devs, Plutus/Atala Prism Pioneers, Educators and Accountants
